etymology.description: Semantic 貝(貝) (bèi, "shell, money") + phonetic 易(易) (yì, "easy") = valuable items given -> bestow
etymology.interpretation: 賜(賜) (cì, "bestow") combines 貝(貝) (bèi, "shell, money"), indicating wealth or valuables, with 易(易) (yì), chosen for its phonetic value, to convey the action of bestowing or granting valuable items.
etymology.simplification: Simplified by replacing 貝(貝) (bèi, "shell, money") with 贝(贝) (bèi, "shell, money") to maintain the semantic element while reducing complexity.

examples.chinese: 皇帝賜恩(皇帝賜恩)，群臣受福(群臣受福)。
examples.pinyin: Huángdì cì ēn, qúnchén shòu fú.
examples.english: The emperor bestowed grace, and his officials received blessings.

examples.chinese: 聖上賜旨(聖上賜旨)，百官遵命(百官遵命)。
examples.pinyin: Shèng shàng cì zhǐ, bǎiguān zūn mìng.
examples.english: The sovereign bestowed his decree, and the ministers obeyed.

examples.chinese: 国君賜封英才(國君賜封英才)。
examples.english: The monarch bestowed a title upon the talented.
